page.title: 07Houses and School
page.content: The oldest estate houses are those built around Werburgh Drive.The bridge which crosses Longton Brook at Bainbridge Road is dated 1959.These houses are detached and semi-detached with some bungalows.The second estate is built around the Ash Green Primary School.The school is in extensive grounds of playing fields and its buildings are on two sites.The number on roll stands at 530 with about 25 staff.There is a nursery class unit for 30 children and the school has its own kitchen to provide meals at lunchtime.There is a caretakers house in the grounds of the school.The third area of housing is built around the loop of Pacific Road and Constance Avenue.Land in the centre of the loop,originally designated for a school,is now being built on.Here again the homes are privately owned.
